image.name: H000473_001

profileText: A Delegate from Maryland; born at ``Clover Fields Farm,'' near Queenstown, Queen Annes County, Md., in 1737; engaged in planting; provincial treasurer of Eastern Shore, Md., in 1773; surveyor of Talbot County, Md.; colonel of the Twentieth Battalion, Queen Annes County Militia, in 1777; justice of the peace of Queen Annes County in 1777; member of the State senate 1779-1781; Member of the Continental Congress 1782-1783; again served in the State senate in 1786, 1790, and 1800; resumed agricultural pursuits; died in Queen Annes County, June 5, 1812; interment in Clover Fields Farm Cemetery, Queen Annes County, Md.

asset.name: H000473_001

researchRecord.name: 1763, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Hemsley to Mssrs. Robert & James Christie written on November 15, 1763. In the letter, Hemsley writes about ordering linen and silverware.

recordLocation.name: Department of Literary and Historical Manuscripts

researchRecord.name: 1786, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Hemsley to Thomas Tilghman written on June 15, 1786. In the letter, Hemsley writes about the shipment of some tobacco.

recordLocation.name: Department of Literary and Historical Manuscripts

researchRecord.name: In the William Tilghman correspondence, 1772-1827, 24 linear feet.
